intro: Cinchona remijiana, commonly known as the Colombian quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by yellowish-orange berries. Its bark contains alkaloids, though it is less commonly used for medicinal purposes compared to other cinchona species. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems and has cultural significance in its native regions.
